N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 176.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in chapter 507 of the Laws of 1974, as amended by
chapter 903 of the Laws of 1984, and in this Part: (a) Salary shall mean only gross wages paid
to the employee. Salary shall not include any cost to the employer for such
expenditures as those made for social security, retirement, any form of
employee insurance, fringe benefits, dues or reimbursement of the employee for
any expense incurred as the result of employment. (b) Fringe benefits shall mean the employer's
share of the following benefits, to the extent such share is actually paid for
the benefit of employees engaged in providing required services: retirement, social security, workers' compensation insurance, life insurance, unemployment
insurance, disability insurance health insurance, and union welfare benefits. The cost of employee maintenance such as meals, housing, and clothing, is not a
fringe benefit for the purpose of this subdivision. (c) Actual cost shall mean: (1)
the actual amount of money directly
expended for reporting, evaluating and administering pupil evaluation programs
(PEP), program evaluation tests (PET), the basic educational data system
(BEDS), Regents examinations, Regents scholarship examinations, the statewide
evaluation plan, the uniform procedure for pupil attendance and high school
graduation reporting, the Regents Competency Testing Program and the Regents

Preliminary Competency Testing Program, and for reports required for
comprehensive school improvement planning and for the registration of high
schools and for documentation of the implementation of course requirements in
technology education, home and career skills, and library and information
skills; and
(2)
the cost of
supplies, postage and time spent by employees of a nonpublic school located in
the City of New York, Buffalo or Rochester for the collection, verification, compilation, submission, and auditing of immunization data for all students
attending, entering, or transferring to such school. Such immunization data
shall include the individual pupil immunization records and the New York State
immunization survey summary. (d) In calculating actual costs, schools
shall determine the time spent on each required service for which apportionment
is requested by employing time standards established by the commissioner for
each service, which may be a prescribed number of hours spent in each mandated
service area for teachers, administrators or support staff; or computed on the
basis of such factors which may include, but shall not be limited to: the
number of pupils tested, the number of examination or test papers processed or
the number of candidates for diplomas or certificates. Notes
